intro: Hieracium subcroceum, commonly known as the lesser yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in summer, are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Hieracium subcroceum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
